subject: Tomorrow's the Big Game
event:
I'm sorry the Jets won't be playing, but hey, it's still the SuperBowl, so I'll be watching.

I kinda sorta like both of these teams, so I have no strong rooting interest.  I suppose I'll be pulling for the Saints.  New Orleans deserves some good news after all that Katrina and George W. Bush have put them through, the Saints have never won one before, Drew Brees seems a good guy, I liked Jonathan Vilma when he was a Jet and Jeremy Shockey when he was a Giant, and they have that whole underdog thing going for them.  When in doubt, root for the underdog.

But I won't be distraught if the Colts win, as I would be if it were, say, the Cowboys or the Patriots.  (If the Cowboys and the Patriots ever meet in the Superbowl, I will need to root for the earth to open and swallow both teams and the stadium).  The Colts are a classy team as well, and Peyton is Eli's big brother, after all.  My heart may be pulling for Nawlins, but my head says it will be Indy.

And we'll have friends over, and there will be beer, and chips and salsa, crab puffs and egg rolls and chicken wings, plus the SuperBowl commercials.  Can't beat that.

Forget Independence Day.  SuperBowl Sunday is America's real national holiday.

comments.article:
If the Cowboys vs Patriots ever happen in the superbowl, the earth WILL open up and swallow the stadium. Then throw up in about 30 minutes due to nastiness.

Geaux Saints!
comments.subject: you crack me up

comments.article:
I really loathe football, but I love stories, and thus can't help but root for the Saints this year. Their narrative is just SO compelling. 43 years of losing, horrendous disaster-and the the effing SuperBowl. If someone in Hollywood wrote that, it would go straight to DVD as to trite, even for Hollywood.

New Orleans deserves something they can be unreservedly happy about, and I really hope they take this one home.

I hope that your Sunday, what with the beer and friends and crab puffs, is as lovely as it sounds. =)
I think it's a holiday here in Canada as well. We won't get the commercials until the Monday morning news programs though. Silly Canadian content laws!
comments.subject: Super Bowl

comments.article: For some reason, none of my friends watch football.  Ever.  And they refuse to watch the Super Bowl with me no matter how much beer, salsa, chips, and Chicago-style hot dogs I offer them.  Go figure.  So go ahead and have fun for the two of us...
comments.subject: Envy...

comments.article: Really? Please. It's so hard to listen to ignorance, but to post that kind of grammar on a literary blog, ouch.
comments.subject: who dat?

comments.article: Still hard for me to get used to watching the Super Bowl on Monday morning here :-> However, I'll have more of the authentic experience this year, as an observant Aussie friend of mine has an American wife who grew up in New Orleans and was really happy when I suggested that she come over to our place to watch the game on our absurdly large new TV. She's even bringing kosher red beans and rice!!! Have to agree that although I think nearly everyone in the US except people from Indianapolis and the Colts family members are pulling for the Saints, the Colts are the better team. However, stranger things have happened. Geaux Saints!

How about the Saints win with all they've been through like Katrina and a corrupt mayor of the city who squandered tax payer money and federal money intended to repair the crumbling levies?  Mr. Martin I understand you're a democrat but lets be honest in placing any kind of wrong doing.  Go Colts!!
comments.subject: George Bush???

comments.upictitle: Save the Cheerleader, Save the World: Brothels and Pirates
comments.article:
Yay!

WHO DAT! Geaux Saints!
If I were supporting a team, I'd go with the Saints because my HS and college colors were black-and-gold...and so is my SCA device (sable, a narwhal naiant contourny).

speaking as ferocious Saints fan, devastated by your ambivalence:

"I kinda sorta like [all fantasy authors], so I have no strong rooting interest. I suppose I'll be pulling for the [GRRM]. "
Try a different analogy, this one made no sense, given that writing a book is hardly a competition where one person will win and the other will lose.

I'm all for the Saints as well, and so this Patriots fan (ducks beer can) will be rooting with you.

Meanwhile, over in Thailand, I hope Patrick's stomach is well enough to read of those wonderful crab puffs and egg rolls.
(cursing for missing you with the beer can)
That's OK, over here we don't understand cricket.

I'm pulling for the Saints but I fear the Colts will win.  We'll be having a veggie tray, shrimp cocktail, chips and salsa and lots of beer.  I'm looking forward to next year when the Niners take the NFC west (especially now with no Kurt Warner).  See you in the playoffs, George!  By the way...I have just finished Dreamsongs, Vol. 2.  I am now a huge fan of Tuf and his voyages.  'Skin Trade' is also very impressive.  Have a great Holiday!  You rule!
comments.subject: Go Saints!

comments.article: I think the over/under for total points in this game should be about 75 points. It is going to be a shoot out. I can't remember if we have ever had a real shoot out in a superbowl.
comments.subject: over/under

comments.article: At this point, all I'm rooting for is that it not be a blowout.  I hate being bored for 3 1/2 hours.
Exactly.  Which is why this game was so good - battling it out till the deciding play with just 3 minutes to go.

The JETS were *so* close. My Father bought a bottle of champagne for every week they played. (My coming home outfit when I was born was a JETS uniform lol)

It would have been nice to see them at the SuperBowl!

But hey, its a great day to get some pizza, beer and wings and have a great time anyways!
Colts FTW!!! ;)
comments.subject: My asinine web comment

comments.article:
Been reading for a while (ever since I devoured ASoFaI 1 through 4 in a month last year), but this will be my first post.

It's funny, since I don't really care about "Armoured Rugby" :P, but of all things, my first post was caused by a genuine "LOL" reaction at the following sentiment:

If the Cowboys and the Patriots ever meet in the Superbowl, I will need to root for the earth to open and swallow both teams and the stadium.

I can relate. Different continent, different sport, different teams (naturally), same feeling.

Enjoy the match!
comments.subject: Heh...

comments.article: You seem like a good dude George but having your feet in two different football camps(Giants ,Jets) is brutal....I'm a Bills fan and if any fans should be supporting two teams you'd think it would be us.....we'll suck next yr too and that's all we need is a rejuvenated Jets to contend with next yr...maybe my Toronto Argonauts can win the Grey Cup (Canadian football league) ...but probably not, there in worst shape than the Bills LOL
comments.subject: betting on da Saints

comments.article:
Well, you have two teams too if you root for both the Argonauts and the Bills.

Sure, they're in two different leagues and never play.

But that was true for the Giants and the Jets as well, when I started cheering for Gang Green as well as Big Blue.

Yes, I'm THAT old.
comments.subject: Re: betting on da Saints

comments.article:
A local radio show here in Albuquerque does what they call 'Super Blow' every year - they have listeners call in and blow up eggs marked with the team names in their microwaves, and the team whose egg blows up first is going to lose. It's been accurate for three of the past four years, and this year, the yolk was on the Colts. (Or, the Colts' yolk was all over the insides of some peoples' microwaves.)

I'm with you on just watching it for the sake of a good game, though. Never was much into football, but it's always fun to get together with friends and cheer. And hey, if you don't care who wins, you get to cheer and get excited no matter who scores. *grin*

I sympathize with N.O. but my company is Indy-based, so if I root at all it'll be for the Colts.  I also don't think the Saints would be in the game if it wasn't for a bad call last time out.  That's always annoyed me about NFL playoffs...seems that bad play calls are more frequent and more deadly.
...but I'm still hoping my Ravens can pull this one out of the fire, somehow.  Anyone want to take any bets?
comments.subject: Call me crazy...

comments.article: Go Saints!  Cant stand Patton Manning maybe thats because im a Patriots fan -.O
comments.subject: Super Bowl

comments.article:
"(If the Cowboys and the Patriots ever meet in the Superbowl, I will need to root for the earth to open and swallow both teams and the stadium)"

I'm not much of a football fan, but that was the funniest thing I read all day.
You have completely summed up how I feel about this Super Bowl. Thank you!
